page.title: 05EMPLOYMENT
page.content: { Full and part-time jobs}are found in the banks, schools (the High School is the largest employer), garages, old people's homes and pubs and on a small industrial estate on the site of the old railway station (closed in 1963). Here are found the Roundwood Press; Mary Glasgow Baker, book distributers; a sheet metal business and an electrical firm. In recent years many people have become{self employed,}following redundancy setting up small businesses in property maintenance, window cleaning, home based crafts and secretarial. A few people are still engaged in farm work but by far the majority{commute}to Stratford, Warwick, Leamington Spa, Banbury and Coventry and some to British Leyland's test track at Gaydon and the Army Central Ammunition Depot, 4 miles away
